info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 3:55PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Garfield, southeastern Uintah and northeastern Grand Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 354 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an areas of strong thunderstorms 43 miles northwest of Fruita, or 49 miles northeast of Green River, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Garfield, southeastern Uintah and northeastern Grand Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
